thread.title: The Chase’s Dark Destroyer finds himself in hot water after telling 19-year-old to go ‘Walkies’
thread.title_full: The Chase’s Dark Destroyer finds himself in hot water after telling 19-year-old to go ‘Walkies’

author: hrichardson
title: The Chase’s Dark Destroyer finds himself in hot water after telling 19-year-old to go ‘Walkies’
text:
— Ash Goldsmith (@ashleygiow) February 3, 2017 "You're the best 19 year old I've ever come across." The Dark Destroyer #thechase #dirtyfiend 😂 
— Jamie Miller (@JM1UTD) February 3, 2017 "You're the best 19 year old I've ever come across"Sean "The Dark Destroyer" Wallace #TheChase pic.twitter.com/ddxYFzKFcx 
— Paul Hoppy (@PaulHoppy) February 3, 2017 
One viewer tweeted: "Awkward moment when the chaser says ‘You're the best 19 year old I've ever come across" #TheChase." 
Another wrote: “’You’re the best 19 year old I've ever come across.' The Dark Destroyer #thechase #dirtyfiend” while one added: “Chaser talking filth there #thechase.” 
An eagle-eyed viewer observed: "#TheChase SEAN - "She's the best 19 year old I've come across". Bradley moved on very fast!" Related Stories Double vision The Chase contestant looks like the adorable old man from Disney film Up... and everybody loves it 'Two vodkas and it's off' Bradley Walsh has contestant and 'The Vixen' in stitches on The Chase with lewd jokes 'he had an absolute mare' The Chase contestants win huge £46k as the Sinnerman crumbles under the pressure 'BETTER THE WALL THAN BRADLEY' The Beast says he punched the wall after he got the question RIGHT but it was disallowed CUT TO THE CHASE The Chase viewers call for Shaun Wallace to RETIRE after he puts in shockingly bad performance 
Shocked by his admission, Bradders did indeed attempt to move the show along to avoid yet more embarrassment for Paiton. 
Paiton continued to impress in her round with the Dark Destroyer, making it home safe with her £7K. 
The Dark Destroyer admitted: “With her youth she’s going to be a danger in the final chase.” ITV 3 Bradley did his best to assure Paiton the Dark Destroyer wasn't calling her a dog 
He was right, as in a tense showdown Wallace lost out by one question, meaning the team took home their prize pot.
